image.altText: A baby sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Loriann Harris said she would have assessed Kobi Shepherdson's case as high risk if she had seen the mother's early statement about Henry Shepherdson's abusive behaviour.

title.children: Police officer breaks down during inquest into death of baby Kobi, saying she missed threats to kill in father's file

image.altText: Screengrab of mobile vision showing people with blurred faces standing under an awning.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General and Aboriginal Affairs Minister Kyam Maher has spoken to the state's Police Commissioner, following "confronting" footage taken during an arrest near Port Augusta at the weekend.

title.children: 'Confronting' vision of a man being dragged by police has prompted a formal assessment — what happened and what is the response?

image.altText: A Highland cattle stands in a field with the sun setting behind it

props.synopsis: Two pets living in the greater Adelaide region have gone missing within days of each other, with both owners pleading for their return.

title.children: 'Now it's too coincidental': Owners plead for return of beloved animals missing within days of each other

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja chairing the domestic violence royal commission.

props.synopsis: In the space of a single week, four women were killed in separate and unrelated incidents in SA. A year on, the state's royal commission has heard that there are not adequate services to keep up with the increase in domestic violence cases.

title.children: Domestic violence royal commission begins hearings a year after 'worst week in any jurisdiction'

image.altText: A woman on a beach with severely weathered ropes around her neck

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island tour guides Mia Bertetto and Nikki Redman say they have a blunt message for tourists and locals — "don't garbage paradise".

title.children: The 'heartbreaking, never-ending' rubbish on Australia's third-largest island

image.altText: readbook2

props.synopsis: A government department says it will stop partnering with a charity run by Plymouth Brethren Christian Church members. A school run by church members has also been referred to regulators following allegations that students are discouraged from attending on-campus university.

title.children: SA Health to cut ties with charity run by Brethren members, school referred to regulators

image.altText: A blue sculpture on a footpath outside a historic building

props.synopsis: A sculpture design has caused a stir in a regional South Australian community, but the local council says that is the point of public art.

title.children: Mount Gambier's 'blue blob' sculpture to go ahead, despite fierce online backlash

image.altText: black and white image of koala on podium

props.synopsis: Commercial radio started with a bang in Adelaide after a live broadcast of federal election results in 1925 prompted a police response when 5,000 people gathered outside the studio of 5CL, which would later become the ABC.

title.children: From amateur broadcasts reaching New York, to the ABC and SA-FM's Skyshow, Adelaide celebrates 100 years of radio

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: The company says it will use some of the funds to fix the Whyalla steelwork's blast furnace which has been offline since August.

title.children: GFG Alliance secures $150 million loan to pay staff and fund repairs

image.altText: A sandy bay with a small jetty and swimming pontoon

props.synopsis: Port Elliot's swimming pontoon has been loved by local swimmers, surf clubs and tourists for over a decade, but the council says it could cost $186,000 annually to reinstall it after it washed up on the beach during a storm.

title.children: Council seeks 'low cost' options to get swimming pontoon back in the water after $180k insurance shock

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: The enduring love story that defied the White Australia policy

image.altText: Radio host David Bevan on air.

props.synopsis: Renowned, esteemed and much-loved ABC Radio Adelaide presenter David Bevan has announced his retirement after more than 20 years on the airwaves.

title.children: 'You've ruined my eye make-up': David Bevan's retirement prompts tributes and tears from listeners

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: As US President Joe Biden eyes an exit to the world stage, China's Xi Jinping made full use of the G20 to barnstorm his way through meetings with world leaders to stitch together relationships in anticipation of Donald Trump's return.

title.children: The APEC and G20 summits had a 97kg fake-tanned elephant hanging over them

image.altText: a man holding a flag in front of a giant missile on a truck

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a revised doctrine lowering the bar for Moscow's use of its atomic arsenal, including in response to conventional weapons. Does it change the likelihood of Russia using its nuclear capabilities?

title.children: Russia has revamped its nuclear policy. What now?

image.altText: Kevin Rudd smiles and points as he walks through the marble foyer of parliament house.

props.synopsis: In his first public remarks since the re-election of Donald Trump, Kevin Rudd says he is "ready" to work with the incoming administration despite his previous critical comments.

title.children: Kevin Rudd insists he is 'ready' to deal with incoming Trump administration

image.altText: AFL draftee Sam Lalor stands on stage holding a Richmond guernsey next to former Tigers captain Trent Cotchin.

props.synopsis: The time has come for the next generation of AFL stars to find their teams. Follow live as all 18 clubs make their selections in the first round of the 2024 draft.

title.children: Richmond takes Sam Lalor with number one pick of 2024 AFL draft

image.altText: Ivona Jovanovic taking a selfie in a mirror in 2019

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast man previously charged over the death of his former partner has maintained his innocence despite being urged to "go deep into your heart" and be honest about how she died.

title.children: Ex-partner maintains innocence at inquest into Gold Coast woman's shooting death

image.altText: a man holds a photo of Mary Jane Veloso

props.synopsis: Philippine woman Mary Jane Veloso is to be transferred to a prison in her homeland after years of negotiations.

title.children: Filipina spared from Bali Nine firing squad to be returned home

image.altText: A side-on head and shoulders snapshot of a 66-year-old Caucasian man with grey hair, wearing glasses and a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The former Sunshine Coast celebrity will spend at least six months behind bars after being found guilty of child sex offences against a 13-year-old girl in 1988.

title.children: Former Queensland radio host Peter Lang jailed for historical child sex offences

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a wall of American flags.

props.synopsis: It's now eight years since Salena Zito made probably the most pellucid observation of all about Trump: "The press takes him literally, but not seriously; his supporters take him seriously, but not literally."

title.children: Why are we still taking Donald Trump literally?

image.altText: A man with glasses in a shirt looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Welsh American journalist Jon Ronson has interviewed conspiracy theorists, neo-Nazis and soldiers trained as psychics. This week, at his live shows, he'll teach you to spot a psychopath.

title.children: Jon Ronson will teach you how to spot a psychopath. Then he'll explain the dangers of labelling people

image.altText: A white silky bantam chicken.

props.synopsis: Peter William Smith removed the silky bantam chicken from an enclosure at a wildlife park earlier this year before tossing it into the alligator enclosure where it was eaten.

title.children: Grandfather who threw 'Betty White' the chicken to alligators at wildlife park spared jail

image.altText: A "sorry we're closed" sign in the window of a shopfront.

props.synopsis: The rate of business failures is now the highest it has been since the COVID-19 pandemic, and it is only set to grow as the cost of doing business squeezes companies from all sides.

title.children: Businesses are failing at near the highest rate on record

image.altText: A man looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride has given an interview to the ABC from the Canberra prison where he is serving a sentence of more than five years for leaking secret military documents to journalists.

title.children: 'It's a dangerous place': Whistleblower David McBride tells of his life in Canberra prison

image.altText: Lula, a shorter Brazilian man with a white beard, smiles as he poses for a picture with Joe Biden, both wearing suits

props.synopsis: Billionaires could be forced to pay a minimum rate of tax on their wealth after a global grouping of nations agrees to effectively tax the ultra-rich.

title.children: Brazil's president is trying to get billionaires taxed fairly — here's where he has got to so far

image.altText: Cockroaches crawling all over rows of concrete sheeting

props.synopsis: Seeing a cockroach scutter across your kitchen floor is off-putting for many Australians, but there are some things you can do to keep on top of them. And it's important to note, they can be beautiful.

title.children: Cockroaches are 'almost inescapable' when it's warm. Here's how to keep them at bay

image.altText: a white hard hat with rio tinto written in red

props.synopsis: While half of the mining-giant's employees think its culture is improving, bullying against female staff is up since 2022 in an internal progress report published today.

title.children: Rio Tinto workplace report reveals female staff suffering from backlash to diversity measures

image.altText: Palestinians with backpack cary household items as they flee along an unsealed road that runs between damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: The IDF's siege of northern Gaza is now into its second month, leading many to question whether Israel has adopted a controversial plan to conquer the area.

title.children: Former general who plans to starve 'combatants' out of northern Gaza slams critics

image.altText: Child holding hand

props.synopsis: Leading family violence advocates call for children to be directly involved in designing policy, and urgent investment in support services and training in an effort to prevent child abuse.

title.children: 'Stop failing the next generation of kids': New guide released for preventing child abuse

image.altText: Gail Ferrari-Hirst and Russell Hirst embrace while standing

props.synopsis: Just 18 days before Russell Wayne Hirst died of a cardiac event in November 2021, superannuation giant Cbus cancelled his insurance policy, leaving the beneficiary of his account in a year-long fight to have her claim approved.

title.children: 'Absolutely unacceptable': Cbus cancels customer's insurance days before his death

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits in an office with brightly coloured wallpaper behind her

props.synopsis: The prolific wallpaper designer reinvented herself many times and embroidered her biography. But years after her death, her murderer is still unknown.

title.children: Glamorous designer Florence Broadhurst's secrets came out at her funeral, but her killer remains unknown

image.altText: Photo of a young woman with red hair and nose piercings

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Missing Persons Squad have charged a 53-year-old man with murder and a 57-year-old man with assisted murder after the disappearance of 19-year-old Brunswick woman Isla Bell.

title.children: Man charged with murder after human remains found at a tip during search for missing Melbourne teenager Isla Bell

image.altText: Trump attends SpaceX's launch of world's most powerful rocket

props.synopsis: SpaceX has aborted an attempt to catch the first stage booster of its Starship mega rocket in the "chopstick" arms of its launch tower in an ocean splashdown.

title.children: SpaceX fails to catch megarocket in 'chopstick' arms as Trump, Musk look on

image.altText: A woman with short auburn hair looks at the ground while walking through a door

props.synopsis: The Frenchwoman and her ex-husband have given their final statements in court as the mass rape trial involving 51 men enters its final stages.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot says mass rape trial of 51 men is one of 'cowardice'

image.altText: Backs of school students in uniform

props.synopsis: Hackers are increasingly eyeing private schools as a "honey pot" for ransomware, with the average cost of cybercrime to small businesses hitting almost $50,000.

title.children: Hackers targeting private schools as authorities warn of 'evolving' cyber threats
